Don, it looks like you have a problem with your installation. Please note that Bugzilla is not a support forum. I suggest asking your problem in the newsgroups.

See http://www.eclipse.org/newsgroups/ for details.

A good start would probably be the eclipse.newcomer newsgroup.
http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/thread.php?group=eclipse.newcomer

As a side node, you should provide more details about your environment when submitting issues. It's impossible to guess what is wrong here.

(In reply to comment #1)
> Don, it looks like you have a problem with your installation. Please note that
> Bugzilla is not a support forum. I suggest asking your problem in the
> newsgroups.
> See http://www.eclipse.org/newsgroups/ for details.
> A good start would probably be the eclipse.newcomer newsgroup.
> http://www.eclipse.org/newsportal/thread.php?group=eclipse.newcomer
> As a side node, you should provide more details about your environment when
> submitting issues. It's impossible to guess what is wrong here.

Downloaded Zip file for 3.2 twice. Zip file passed CRC Test of contents. Installed in virgin directory. Still crashed on startup with same log contents about NullPointer. Problem is not with download. Does not appear to be an install problem.
Downloaded 3.1.1 version. Installed and ran OK.
Why is version 3.2 crashing when 3.1.1 runs OK? Why is software not protected against using a NullPointer? Why doesn't the software give better error messages about what is the cause of the problem and its solution?
How do I get around this problem?(
Please attach the complete log file.  Thanks.

If the log does not provide any additional information please run the following command from your eclipse installation directory.

java -jar startup.jar

Report back any additional output (if any) this command prints to the console.

That was the entire log file listed in the bug report.

D:\!projects\ebXML\eclipse>

Looks like having a '!' char in the install path of eclipse is causing lots of things to go wrong.  The work around should be to move the eclipse installation from D:\!projects\ebXML\eclips to D:\projects\ebXML\eclipse without the '!' char.

What VM are you using?  It seems like the URLClassLoader is giving us some problems with the classpath URLs with '!'.

The original NPE posted in commont 0 has been addressed in bug 151413.

Don, can you confirm that extracting eclipse into a path without a '!' fixes your startup problem?
*** Bug 151888 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

As for 151888, removing an exclamation mark fixes the bug there (reproduced on 2 different machines with Java 1.4.something and 1.5.0_02, both WinXP).

I think I traced the problem back to java (I'm using the 1.5.0_2 version):
Class.getProtectionDomain().getCodeSource().getLocation() (invoked from org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptorEclipseStarter, line 131) returns an URL with an exclamation mark unescaped.

However, when replaced with "%21", URL.openConnection() seems to work, so there might be a workaround.

ops... a typo. I meant URL.openStream().

Also, I forgot to write: an exclamation mark causes problems because it's considered to be a separator in case of a "jar:..." URL. So it's not the classloader that fails, it's the URL.openStream() that fails when '!'s are unescaped.

This is a known issue and is covered in the README file shipped with Eclipse.

Also see bug 3109 and bug 17281.
